lore: You wake up in a strange horse-drawn cart. There is a guard driving the cart and the only other passenger is a clown.
choices: Jump off the back of the cart
choiceTransition: You jump off the cart and roll until you finally come to rest in a forest well off the path.
You have a nice conversation with the clown. Near the end of your journey he honks his horn and disappears. Weird.
The guard tells you to shut up. Typical guard mentality.

lore: You can hear voices and other noises coming from beyond the trees.
choices: Find your way back to the path and follow the cart tracks
choiceTransition: You decide to investigate all the strange noises.
You decide nothing good can come out of chasing down scary noises and stay put.
Regretting your choices you decide to work your way back and follow the tracks left by the cart. However, now you have to walk. Nice one.

lore: You find a bandit camp filled with all sorts of scary looking people.
choiceTransition: You make a laughable attempt of a cavalry charge. Not surprising given your lack of a horse, armor, weapons, or anything knightly. The bandits knock you out easily and you wake up in a new place.
You turn to try and run but end up tripping and landing on some pots and pans creating a clatter. The bandits easily take you prisoner and leave you in a strange place.
You attempt to blend in. It fails. They bonk you on the head and you wake up in a strange new place.

lore: Since you were unwilling to go to the noises, the noises decided to come to you in the form of an angry bandit who promptly skewers you for your cowardice.

You arrive at the cart's destination, the king of the land's glorious castle. You are brought before him and he delivers an ultimatum. "Paint my fence or you shall never see the light of day again" he cries!
choices: Accept his offer and paint his fence
Decide nothing matters and attempt to kill the king
choiceTransition: The king brings you to his horrendously flaking fence. "Make this fence fit for a king," he exclaims skipping daintily away.
You refuse. The king, as they usually do, takes offense to this and you are promptly thrown in the dungeon.

Lacking more than a few brain cells you decide to rush the king with nothing more than your bare hands. Incredibly, the king is terrified and has a heart attack on the spot. As you "bested" the king in combat, the guards declare you the new king.

lore: You are unceremoniously thrown into a cell. Luckily for you there's a nice a capella group imprisoned in the cell next you, and you drop the mic on life among friends.
As the new king, you must address your people. As you gaze upon your new subjects you desperately think of ways to play off the murder(?) of the king.
choices: Try and use the king's ending as a show of force
Try and focus on new changes that would benefit the people
Say you just didn't like him lmao
choiceTransition: You give a very threatening speech with plenty of nods towards the fact that you just killed their king sprinkle throughout.

You give an upbeat speech trying to convince them of how great life will be and what a utopia you will build. However, they view this as just an attempt to cozy up to them and decide to throw you in jail.
Gazing upon the crowd, you decide honesty is the best policy. "I just thought he sucked" you explain to the crowd.

lore: Since you painted yourself as such a big powerful man, a few of your subjects decide to challenge you. Unfortunately, they do not have heart attacks and end up ending your reign almost as fast as you got it.
The crowd, surprisingly, agrees. They decide you would be a massive upgrade and leave you as the supreme emperor of the known universe.
True to your word, you begin painting the fence. However you notice a strange staircase leading to the sky and an unguarded path just past the fence.
choiceTransition: You continue to paint the fence.
You begin to climb the staircase.
You run for the path. Absolutely no one tries to stop you. After like five minutes of running you need a break and stop near a strange structure.

lore: Taking a break you review your options. Notably those that are not painting a fence.
choiceTransition: You continue to paint the fence.
You begin to climb the staircase.
You run for the path. Absolutely no one tries to stop you. After like five minutes of running you need a break and stop near a strange structure.

lore: Why am I doing this to myself, you wonder staring longingly at the two methods for to escape the purgatory that is preventative maintenance.
choiceTransition: You continue to paint the fence.
You begin to climb the staircase.
You run for the path. Absolutely no one tries to stop you. After like five minutes of running you need a break and stop near a strange structure.

lore: After hours of painting the fence looks truly beautiful. The king, told of your success, drops to his knees at the sight. "You deserve this more than I!" he proclaims handing you his crown and promptly climbing the stairway to heaven.
You climb the Stairway to Heaven. You do make it, but you do actually end up dying. Who could have seen that coming?
You gaze upon a scary looking house. A monster house if you will. You feel a strange pull towards it and begin to look for ways inside.
choiceTransition: Feeling bold you waltz right in through the front door hoping nothing terrible will happen.
You decide to play it a tad safe, and you find an unlocked window to clamber through.
You spot a chimney, and being so full of the holiday spirit you decide to take after your idol and go down it!

lore: You find yourself in a living room. You feel safer, knowing that no dead can touch you there. You see three doors, leading to the bathroom, kitchen, and the bedroom.
choiceTransition: You decide to investigate the bathroom. After giving the door a quick knock, you enter.
Feeling a bit peckish, you decide to hit the kitchen to see if there are any monster snacks.
Feeling adventurous you go to investigate the bedroom.

lore: You find yourself in the most beautiful bathroom you've ever seen, with a spacious bathtub and a throne fit for a king.
choiceTransition: Finding nothing that interests you, you return to the living room.
You decide to sit in the bathtub (fully clothed of course).
As it is a monster throne, you decide to test its power by flushing yourself.

lore: After you sit in the tub and turn the water you feel a dizzying sensation and close your eyes. When you open them you find yourself not in a bathroom, but in Tahiti! "I just played the best bath of my life!," you exclaim to yourself. You happily live out the rest of your days farming mangoes in Tahiti.

It turns out it was indeed powerful enough to flush yourself, and you find yourself in a great sewer based city with your every desire! Years later you produce a movie about your life, but with all characters turned to rats to protect your city and identities.
You see a nicely equipped kitchen. Surprisingly you see the nice clown from the cart at the beginning of your journey standing there.
choiceTransition: No longer hungry and scared of clowns, you flee to the living room.
You run to the fridge hoping for a choccy milk for your epic.
The clown regales you with tales from his circus.

lore: The clown snickers as you whip open the door, knowing what comes next. As you open the door tentacles shoot out and pull you in, never to be seen again.
After hearing his stories you decide to join him in the circus life, and you toot horns and juggle together for the rest of your lives.
You see a nice nightstand standing next to the most comfortable bed you have ever seen.
choiceTransition: Wary of falling asleep or stealing for now, you return to the living room.
You decide a little theft never hurt anybody and begin rifling through the nightstand.
You decide to take a nap, in a strange scary looking house that everyone around avoids.

lore: Searching through the drawers you find something. The Nuts! Suddenly feeling at peace you leave the house and live out the rest of your days in happiness.
You lay down, falling asleep as soon as your head hits the pillow. You see a vision of an old looking man, God, you realize. "Salvation is in the nightstand," he says.
choiceTransition: You graciously accept his gift.
You stupidly reject his gift.
Annoyed at the interruption, you yell "Buzz off old man!"

lore: Angered by your response, thunderclouds appear around God. "To hell with you!" he shouts casting you into, well, Hell.
After squeezing your way through the chimney and tumbling out of the fireplace you see a figure bent under a tree. As he stands up, you recognize him. Its Santa!
choiceTransition: Fearing what other stories your parents told may be true, you run out the door.
Giving Santa your best puppy eyes, you tell him you're cold.
Realizing Santa probably has some back pain, you help him out.

lore: Santa grins at you, and whips out a spare hat from somewhere and plops it on your head. You instantly feel warmer and more jolly. You then decide to become Santa's helper and work for him the rest of your life.
You help Santa decorate the tree. When you finish he lets you have this house's milk and cookies and you leave the house happy to start a new life.
